subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Rain washed out Nascar Sprint Cup qualifying for the second straight week. The field was set by points for Sunday’s Sylvania 300 at New Hampshire Speedway, the first race of the 10-race Chase for the Sprint Cup. That means the 12 drivers in the Chase will start at the front, with the series leader Kyle Busch on the pole and Carl Edwards alongside.
